### load in data

```{r}
library(recount3)
library(rlang)
library(dplyr)
library(dbplyr)
```

```{r}
human_projects <- readRDS("~/data/human_recount3_projects.rds")
```



```{r}
GTEX_proj_info <- subset(
    human_projects,
    file_source == "gtex"
) 
```


```{r}
for ( i in 1:nrow(GTEX_proj_info)){
  name <- paste(GTEX_proj_info[i,1],"rse", sep="_" )
  assign(name, create_rse(GTEX_proj_info[i,]))
}
```

```{r}
name <- paste(GTEX_proj_info[,1],"rse", sep="_" )
gtex_coldata<-  colData(get(name[1]))
for (i in 2:length(name)){
  coldata<-  colData(get(name[i]))
  gtex_coldata<- rbind(gtex_coldata, coldata)
}
```

### Analysis
```{r}
gtex_coldata<- as.data.frame(gtex_coldata)
```


```{r}
table(is.na(gtex_coldata$gtex.age))
table(gtex_coldata$gtex.age)
table(is.na(gtex_coldata$gtex.sex))
table(gtex_coldata$gtex.sex)
```
1= male 2= female 

```{r}
table(gtex_coldata$gtex.dthhrdy)
table(is.na(gtex_coldata$gtex.dthhrdy))
```
0=Ventilator Case
1=Violent and fast death
2=Fast death of natural causes
3=Intermediate death
4=Slow death

How many sample per tissue?
```{r}
as.data.frame(table(gtex_coldata$gtex.smts))
```
substructures of tissues
```{r}
as.data.frame(table(gtex_coldata$gtex.smtsd))
```



```{r}
gtex_coldata$gtex.sex<- factor( ifelse(gtex_coldata$gtex.sex == 1, "M","F" ), levels= c("M", "F"))
gtex_coldata$gtex.dthhrdy <- ifelse(gtex_coldata$gtex.dthhrdy == 0,  "Ventilator_Case", ifelse(gtex_coldata$gtex.dthhrdy == 1,  "Violent_and_Fast_Death", ifelse(gtex_coldata$gtex.dthhrdy == 2,  "Fast_Death_of_Natural_Causes",ifelse(gtex_coldata$gtex.dthhrdy == 3,  "Intermediate_Death" , ifelse(gtex_coldata$gtex.dthhrdy== 4,  "Slow_Death", "Not Reported")))))
```

```{r}
gtex_coldata$SEX_AGE<- paste(gtex_coldata$gtex.sex, gtex_coldata$gtex.age, sep = "_")
```

```{r}
gtex_coldata$SEX_AGE_DEATH<- paste(gtex_coldata$SEX_AGE, gtex_coldata$gtex.dthhrdy ,sep = "_")
```

```{r}
table(gtex_coldata$SEX_AGE_DEATH)
```

```{r}
gtex_coldata2<- gtex_coldata[!is.na(gtex_coldata$gtex.smgebtcht),]
gtex_coldata3<- gtex_coldata2[gtex_coldata2$gtex.smgebtcht == "TruSeq.v1",]
gtex_coldata3<- gtex_coldata3[!is.na(gtex_coldata3$gtex.subjid),]
gtex_coldata4<- gtex_coldata3[!gtex_coldata3$gtex.subjid == "GTEX-11ILO",] 
gtex_coldata<- gtex_coldata4
```

```{r}
library(ggplot2)
library(viridis)
ggplot(sex_table, aes(fill=gtex.sex, y=Freq, x=gtex.smts)) + 
    geom_bar(position="stack", stat="identity") +
    theme_classic()+
    xlab("Tissue") +
    ylab("Count")+
    scale_fill_viridis(discrete = T) + 
    theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle=90, size=3.5), axis.ticks = element_blank())+
    ggtitle("Sex for GTEx tissue") 
ggsave("~/output/GTEx_plots/210806_sex_tissue_GTEx.pdf")
```

```{r}
for (i in 1:length(tissue)){
  data<- age_sex_table_v2[age_sex_table_v2$gtex.smts == tissue[i] , ]
  title<- paste("Sex and Age for GTEx", tissue[i])
  plot <- ggplot(data=data, aes(x=gtex.age, y=Freq, group=gtex.sex)) +
      geom_line(aes(linetype=gtex.sex))+
      geom_point()+
      theme_classic()+
      ggtitle(title) 
  print(plot)
  nfile<- paste("~/output/GTEx_plots/210806_age_sex_GTEx_", tissue[i],".pdf",sep="")
  ggsave(nfile)
}
```

The autolysis score was assigned by a pathologist during a visual inspection of the histology image. The assigned values ranged from 0 to 3 (None, Mild, Moderate, and Severe).

```{r}
ggsave("~/output/GTEx_plots/210806_RIN_tissue_structures_GTEx.pdf")
```
High-quality RNA will contain an RIN of at least 8, where partially fragmented RNA will contain an RIN within the range of 6â€“8. Any RNA sample that has a RIN below 5 should not be subjected to further fragmentation during the ScriptSeq protocol, as it will generate smaller than desired fragments.

```{r}
library(RColorBrewer)
```

the lighter the color the higher the value. 
```{r}
#colorfunc = colorRamp(c("blue", "white","red"))
FUN <- colorRamp(c("black", "#FDE725FF" ))
#col_data_sub$gtex.smrin
MPG <- with(col_data_sub, (gtex.smrin - min(gtex.smrin)) / diff(range(gtex.smrin)))
mycolors = rgb(FUN(MPG), maxColorValue=256)
par(cex=1.0, cex.axis=0.8, cex.main=0.8)
pairs(pca_sub$x[,1:5], col=mycolors, main="Principal components analysis bi-plot\nPCs 1-5", pch=16)
```
